altHandlingCost.description: The handling cost automatically calculates depending on the shipping method you select in the Ship Via field.To change the cost of handling, go to Lists > Shipping Items and select the shipping method with the handling cost you want to change.
altHandlingCost.name: altHandlingCost

altSalesTotal.description: The Alternate Sales Amount feature must be enabled in your account in order to populate this field. The value entered sets an Alternate Sales Amount for line items on the sales order. This value can then be used for commission calculations.
altSalesTotal.name: altSalesTotal

altShippingCost.description: This is a read-only field that returns the shipping costs based on the shipping method selected in shipMethod.
altShippingCost.name: altShippingCost

authCode.description: Sets the authorization code for the transaction. If getAuth is set to true, this is a ready only field that returns the Authorization code when authorization has been requested for the sales order.
authCode.name: authCode

balance.description: The balance owed by this customer.
balance.name: balance

billAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field  defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.externalId.name: billAddressList.externalId

billAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field  defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.internalId.name: billAddressList.internalId

billAddressList.name.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field  defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
billAddressList.name.name: billAddressList.name

billingSchedule.externalId.description: Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
billingSchedule.externalId.name: billingSchedule.externalId

billingSchedule.internalId.description: Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
billingSchedule.internalId.name: billingSchedule.internalId

billingSchedule.name.description: Allows users to reference default Billing Schedules for items.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
billingSchedule.name.name: billingSchedule.name

canHaveStackable.description: Check this box to enable stackable promotions on this transaction.
canHaveStackable.name: canHaveStackable

ccApproved.description: Sets the status of the credit card to approved.
ccApproved.name: ccApproved

ccAvsStreetMatch.value.description: References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to the credit card processor when a credit card transaction takes place.Possible values include _Y, _N _X.The possible values include:_Y � The address information submitted did match._N � The address information submitted did not match._X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned.If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.
ccAvsStreetMatch.value.name: ccAvsStreetMatch.value

ccAvsZipMatch.value.description: References a value in a system list. This value sets the Address Verification Services (AVS) result code returned to credit card processor when a credit card transaction takes place.Possible values include _Y, _N _X.The possible values include:_Y � The address information submitted did match._N � The address information submitted did not match._X � The credit card company does not support AVS, or no information was returned.If getAuth is set to True, this value can NOT be set.
ccAvsZipMatch.value.name: ccAvsZipMatch.value

ccExpireDate.description: Sets the credit card expiration date.
ccExpireDate.name: ccExpireDate

ccName.description: Defaults to the cardholder name from the default credit card on the customer's record. If the default credit card is not selected in creditCard, you must provide this value.
ccName.name: ccName

ccNumber.description: Use this field to set the credit card number. Enter numbers only, without spaces. Partially masked values are not accepted. Only a 16-digit number is accepted.On a get, this value is masked.When searching on this field, you can use only the empty and notEmpty operators.
ccNumber.name: ccNumber

ccSecurityCode.description: Settable only if the Use Card Security Code for Credit Card Transactions company preference is enabled at Set Up > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
ccSecurityCode.name: ccSecurityCode

ccSecurityCodeMatch.value.description: References a value in a system list. Possible values include: _Y � The security code information submitted did match. _N � The security code information submitted did not match. _X � The credit card company does not support security codes.
ccSecurityCodeMatch.value.name: ccSecurityCodeMatch.value

ccStreet.description: Defaults to the street address from the customer's billing address.
ccStreet.name: ccStreet

ccZipCode.description: Defaults to the zip or postal code from the customer's billing address.
ccZipCode.name: ccZipCode

createdFrom.externalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
createdFrom.externalId.name: createdFrom.externalId

createdFrom.internalId.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
createdFrom.internalId.name: createdFrom.internalId

createdFrom.name.description: In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
createdFrom.name.name: createdFrom.name

creditCard.externalId.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.externalId.name: creditCard.externalId

creditCard.internalId.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.internalId.name: creditCard.internalId

creditCard.name.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
creditCard.name.name: creditCard.name

creditCardProcessor.externalId.description: References a user-defined Credit Card Processor record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
creditCardProcessor.externalId.name: creditCardProcessor.externalId

creditCardProcessor.internalId.description: References a user-defined Credit Card Processor record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
creditCardProcessor.internalId.name: creditCardProcessor.internalId

creditCardProcessor.name.description: References a user-defined Credit Card Processor record at Setup > Company > Credit Card Processors. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
creditCardProcessor.name.name: creditCardProcessor.name

currency.externalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: If you do not use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, the currency of the customer you are creating this transaction for is shown here.If you use the Multi-Currency Customers feature, select the transaction currency you want to create this transaction in. This customer's primary currency is selected by default.If you have already selected items on this transaction, selecting a new currency refreshes them to show the price in the new currency (except for items you entered custom prices for) and recalculates tax and gross profit.
currency.name.name: currency.name

currencyName.description: A read only field that defaults to the currency associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.
currencyName.name: currencyName

customForm.externalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: References an existing custom form for this record type. To ensure that field relationships defined within a desired custom form are maintained, you must provide the customForm value. Also, if defaults are off, then customForm is required, if defaults are on then the default form is used. Internal ID values for existing forms can be found at Setup > Customization > Entry Forms. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

debitCardIssueNo.description: Sets the debit card authorization number for UK accounts only. The debit card authorization number is printed on the card. Required for users of SecPay or WorldPay.
debitCardIssueNo.name: debitCardIssueNo

deferredRevenue.description: Deferred Revenue:amount of revenue deferred on this transaction
deferredRevenue.name: deferredRevenue

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when the Make Departments Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when the Make Departments Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when the Make Departments Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
department.name.name: department.name

discountItem.externalId.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
discountItem.externalId.name: discountItem.externalId

discountItem.internalId.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
discountItem.internalId.name: discountItem.internalId

discountItem.name.description: References a value in a user defined discount list. To create new values, click Lists > Accounting > Items > New > Discount. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
discountItem.name.name: discountItem.name

discountRate.description: If the value entered here includes the percent sign, the discount rate applied to the item is calculated as a percent. If the value entered here does not include the percent sign, the discount rate is applied as an absolute discount value.For example, 10% would result in a ten percent discount on the item whereas 10 would result in a ten dollar discount on the item.
discountRate.name: discountRate

discountTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the amount discounted on this sales order.
discountTotal.name: discountTotal

drAccount.externalId.description: This field applies to the Revenue Commitment feature only. After you enable Advanced Revenue Management, this field is ignored in new sales orders.Select the deferred revenue account to post revenue reclassification amounts generated by revenue reclassification journal entries.
drAccount.externalId.displayName: Deferred Revenue Reclassification Account - External id
drAccount.externalId.name: drAccount.externalId

drAccount.internalId.description: This field applies to the Revenue Commitment feature only. After you enable Advanced Revenue Management, this field is ignored in new sales orders.Select the deferred revenue account to post revenue reclassification amounts generated by revenue reclassification journal entries.
drAccount.internalId.displayName: Deferred Revenue Reclassification Account - Internal id
drAccount.internalId.name: drAccount.internalId

drAccount.name.description: This field applies to the Revenue Commitment feature only. After you enable Advanced Revenue Management, this field is ignored in new sales orders.Select the deferred revenue account to post revenue reclassification amounts generated by revenue reclassification journal entries.
drAccount.name.name: drAccount.name

endDate.description: Sets the date for the last invoice. This should only be set if Advanced Billing is being used.
endDate.name: endDate

entity.externalId.description: Sets the customer this sales order is associated with.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
entity.externalId.name: entity.externalId

entity.internalId.description: Sets the customer this sales order is associated with.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
entity.internalId.name: entity.internalId

entity.name.description: Sets the customer this sales order is associated with.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
entity.name.name: entity.name

entityTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - External id
entityTaxRegNum.externalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.externalId

entityTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Customer Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
entityTaxRegNum.internalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.internalId

estGrossProfit.description: Estimated Gross Profit: Read-only field that equals the revenue amount minus the Est. Cost. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfit.name: estGrossProfit

estGrossProfitPercent.description: Estimated Gross Profit Margin, as a percentage: Read-only field that equals the Est. Gross Profit divided by revenue, expressed as a percentage. At the transaction level, it equals the gross profit percent of all lines, factoring transaction-level discounts and markups.
estGrossProfitPercent.name: estGrossProfitPercent

exchangeRate.description: Defaults to the current currency exchange rate as defined in the currency record. This is only settable on an Add.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

excludeCommission.description: If True, the sales order does NOT generate a commission amount. The Commissions feature must be enabled in your account to set this field.
excludeCommission.name: excludeCommission

fob.description: Sets the location where the customers technically acquire ownership.
fob.name: fob

fxAccount.externalId.description: This field applies to the Revenue Commitment feature only. After you enable Advanced Revenue Management, this field is ignored in new sales orders.Select the revenue account to use to post foreign currency adjustments that result when exchange rates are different for billing and revenue postings for this transaction.You must select an income account.
fxAccount.externalId.displayName: Foreign Currency Adjustment Revenue Account - External id
fxAccount.externalId.name: fxAccount.externalId

fxAccount.internalId.description: This field applies to the Revenue Commitment feature only. After you enable Advanced Revenue Management, this field is ignored in new sales orders.Select the revenue account to use to post foreign currency adjustments that result when exchange rates are different for billing and revenue postings for this transaction.You must select an income account.
fxAccount.internalId.displayName: Foreign Currency Adjustment Revenue Account - Internal id
fxAccount.internalId.name: fxAccount.internalId

fxAccount.name.description: This field applies to the Revenue Commitment feature only. After you enable Advanced Revenue Management, this field is ignored in new sales orders.Select the revenue account to use to post foreign currency adjustments that result when exchange rates are different for billing and revenue postings for this transaction.You must select an income account.
fxAccount.name.name: fxAccount.name

getAuth.description: If set to true, NetSuite your payment gateway to process the request according to the processing profile settings.
getAuth.name: getAuth

handlingCost.description: The handling costs displayed in this field are calculated by applying the values pre-defined in the selected Shipping Method. For example you may have a flat rate handling charge for all items sent by US Mail of $1.50. To change handling rates, go to Shipping > Lists > Shipping Items, and select the required shipping method. Click on the Handling Rate subtab.
handlingCost.name: handlingCost

handlingTax1Rate.description: This field shows that tax rate for the handling tax code selected.
handlingTax1Rate.name: handlingTax1Rate

handlingTaxCode.externalId.description: Select the tax code that should apply to any handling charges on this order.
handlingTaxCode.externalId.name: handlingTaxCode.externalId

handlingTaxCode.internalId.description: Select the tax code that should apply to any handling charges on this order.
handlingTaxCode.internalId.name: handlingTaxCode.internalId

handlingTaxCode.name.description: Select the tax code that should apply to any handling charges on this order.
handlingTaxCode.name.name: handlingTaxCode.name

ignoreAvs.description: Check the Ignore AVS box to ignore the results of the Address Verification System (AVS) pre-authorization check. If you choose to ignore the AVS check, when a customer's address information does not match thebilling address of the credit card account, then Cybersource still processes the payment.
ignoreAvs.name: ignoreAvs

intercoStatus.value.description: Intercompany Transaction Status can be:    * Linked - intercompany order has been paired with an intercompany order in another subsidiary.    * Pending - iintercompany order has not been paired with a corresponding order in another subsidiary.    * Rejected - intercompany purchase order or vendor return authorization cannot be paired with a sales order or return authorization because it contains incorrect information, such as subsidiary, currency, amount, or other detail.
intercoStatus.value.name: intercoStatus.value

intercoTransaction.externalId.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs include Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.externalId.name: intercoTransaction.externalId

intercoTransaction.internalId.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs include Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.internalId.name: intercoTransaction.internalId

intercoTransaction.name.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs include Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.name.name: intercoTransaction.name

isMultiShipTo.description: Check this box to enter multiple shipping routes on this order.In the Ship To field, select a shipping address for the customer.The Default Billing address, from the customer record, is automatically displayed in the field. You can add a New address which is saved to the customer record, or enter a Custom address, which only stays on the transaction, and is not saved to the customer record.In the Ship Via field, select the shipping method you want to use for that address.
isMultiShipTo.name: isMultiShipTo

isRecurringPayment.description: This box is checked if this cash sale was generated from a sales order for a recurring payment.Payments marked as recurring can be successfully processed even if the credit card expires during the billing schedule.You should not check this box for standalone cash sales. You should only check this box for transactions with recurring payments. It can be used for cash sale sales orders with billing schedules or memorized cash sale sales order.
isRecurringPayment.name: isRecurringPayment

isTaxable.description: If set to true, the entire order is taxable.
isTaxable.name: isTaxable

job.externalId.description: Select the project associated with this sale.
job.externalId.name: job.externalId

job.internalId.description: Select the project associated with this sale.
job.internalId.name: job.internalId

job.name.description: Select the project associated with this sale.
job.name.name: job.name

leadSource.externalId.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, the field defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
leadSource.externalId.name: leadSource.externalId

leadSource.internalId.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, the field defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
leadSource.internalId.name: leadSource.internalId

leadSource.name.description: Defaults to the lead source associated with the entity set in the entity field. If a lead source is not associated with the entity, and a default lead source has been set up, the field defaults to the value set at Setup > Marketing > Set Up Marketing. The lead source can reference either of the following: If marketing automation is NOT enabled, this field references a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Sales > Setup Tasks > CRM Lists. If marketing automation IS enabled, this field references a value in the campaign list at Lists > Marketing > Campaigns. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
leadSource.name.name: leadSource.name

location.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation..
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation..
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation..
location.name.name: location.name

memo.description: Sets a description for the sales order.
memo.name: memo

message.description: Defaults to the text entered in the messageSel field.
message.name: message

messageSel.externalId.description: Sets the message to display on the form. To create new messages, go to Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
messageSel.externalId.name: messageSel.externalId

messageSel.internalId.description: Sets the message to display on the form. To create new messages, go to Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
messageSel.internalId.name: messageSel.internalId

messageSel.name.description: Sets the message to display on the form. To create new messages, go to Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Customer Message. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
messageSel.name.name: messageSel.name

nexus.externalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic.You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.externalId.name: nexus.externalId

nexus.internalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic.You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.internalId.name: nexus.internalId

nexus.name.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic.You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.name.name: nexus.name

opportunity.externalId.description: Associates the sales order with an opportunity.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
opportunity.externalId.name: opportunity.externalId

opportunity.internalId.description: Associates the sales order with an opportunity.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
opportunity.internalId.name: opportunity.internalId

opportunity.name.description: Associates the sales order with an opportunity.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
opportunity.name.name: opportunity.name

orderStatus.value.description: This field contains the default status for your sales orders, as specified on the Company Preference page.If your company uses the approval process for sales orders, Pending Approval is your default. If your company does not use the approval process, Pending Fulfillment is your default.You can change the status for each sales order here if needed. Available values are:_pendingApproval_pendingFulfillmentImportant: You cannot set orderStatus to _closed if you want to close a sales order. Instead, you must close all the line items on the sales order. The order status of the sales order will then change to closed.
orderStatus.value.name: orderStatus.value

otherRefNum.description: Sets the payment reference number. Set to the check number if your customer is paying by check, or, if your customer is issuing a purchase order, set to the PO number.
otherRefNum.name: otherRefNum

partner.externalId.description: Sets the partner associated with this sales order. Existing partners can be viewed at Lists > Relationships > Partners. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
partner.externalId.name: partner.externalId

partner.internalId.description: Sets the partner associated with this sales order. Existing partners can be viewed at Lists > Relationships > Partners. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
partner.internalId.name: partner.internalId

partner.name.description: Sets the partner associated with this sales order. Existing partners can be viewed at Lists > Relationships > Partners. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
partner.name.name: partner.name

paymentMethod.externalId.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
paymentMethod.externalId.name: paymentMethod.externalId

paymentMethod.internalId.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
paymentMethod.internalId.name: paymentMethod.internalId

paymentMethod.name.description: Reference to a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Payment Method. This value sets the type of card. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
paymentMethod.name.name: paymentMethod.name

pnRefNum.description: Available only if Verisign Integration is set up. Sets VeriSign's unique identifier for every transaction they commit. This is useful when the client uses an external application to verify the Credit Card and then supplies the PNRef to NetSuite.
pnRefNum.name: pnRefNum

promoCode.externalId.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction. Defaults to the default promotion code (if defined) at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Customers associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes. If you select a promotion code associated with a partner, this transaction is attributed to that partner for reporting purposes. To view existing Promotion Codes, go to Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
promoCode.externalId.name: promoCode.externalId

promoCode.internalId.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction. Defaults to the default promotion code (if defined) at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Customers associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes. If you select a promotion code associated with a partner, this transaction is attributed to that partner for reporting purposes. To view existing Promotion Codes, go to Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
promoCode.internalId.name: promoCode.internalId

promoCode.name.description: Sets a promotion code to apply to this transaction. Defaults to the default promotion code (if defined) at Setup > Marketing > Marketing Preferences. Customers associated with a partner can only use that partner's promotion codes. If you select a promotion code associated with a partner, this transaction is attributed to that partner for reporting purposes. To view existing Promotion Codes, go to Lists > Marketing > Promotion Codes. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
promoCode.name.name: promoCode.name

recognizedRevenue.description: Recognized Revenue:cumulative amount of revenue recognized for this transaction
recognizedRevenue.name: recognizedRevenue

revCommitStatus.value.description: This field provides information about Revenue Commitment(s) in the case of a Sales Order or Revenue Commitment Reversal(s) in the case of a Return Authorization.If you uncheck the Rev Rec on Rev Commit. Field, the Rev. Commit. Status field displays information about the related Invoice(s) or Credit Memo(s).The possible values for this field and definitions are as follows:   1. Pending Commitment - No related revenue transactions have been created.   2. Partially Committed - Some related revenue transactions have been created.   3. Committed - All related revenue transactions have been created.
revCommitStatus.value.name: revCommitStatus.value

revRecOnRevCommitment.description: Check this check box to create a Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.    * On a Sales Order, the Revenue Commitment replaces an invoice    * On a Return Authorization, the Revenue Commitment Reversal replaces a credit memo.NetSuite creates all applicable Revenue Recognition schedules the Revenue Commitment or Revenue Commitment Reversal.
revRecOnRevCommitment.name: revRecOnRevCommitment

revenueStatus.value.description: The possible values for this field are:   1. Pending: indicates that no recognition has occurred. All revenue is still deferred.   2. In Progress: indicates that some recognition has occurred.   3. Completed: indicates that all recognition has occurred. No deferred revenue remains.
revenueStatus.value.name: revenueStatus.value

salesEffectiveDate.description: You can change the sales effective date for this transaction.The sales effective date determines which commission plan and historical sales team this transaction applies to.
salesEffectiveDate.name: salesEffectiveDate

salesGroup.externalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
salesGroup.externalId.name: salesGroup.externalId

salesGroup.internalId.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
salesGroup.internalId.name: salesGroup.internalId

salesGroup.name.description: When team selling is enabled, this references a user defined sales team group at Lists > Relationships > Groups. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
salesGroup.name.name: salesGroup.name

salesRep.externalId.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
salesRep.externalId.name: salesRep.externalId

salesRep.internalId.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
salesRep.internalId.name: salesRep.internalId

salesRep.name.description: Defaults to the sales representative associated with the customer referenced by the entity field.In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
salesRep.name.name: salesRep.name

shipAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field  defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.externalId.name: shipAddressList.externalId

shipAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field  defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.internalId.name: shipAddressList.internalId

shipAddressList.name.description: Sets the shipping address for this transaction. This field  defaults to the default Shipping Address set on the associated Customer record. Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer.If an address has NOT been defined, you must first define an address on the Customer record in order to set a billing addess for this transaction.
shipAddressList.name.name: shipAddressList.name

shipComplete.description: Check this box if you want to ship this order only when complete. This will prevent multiple shipments of part-orders. When fulfilling orders in bulk, you can filter the list to include those orders marked Ship Complete that can be completely fulfilled by selecting Respect Ship Complete in the Filter By field.
shipComplete.name: shipComplete

shipDate.description: Sets the ship date for this transaction.
shipDate.name: shipDate

shipMethod.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
shipMethod.externalId.name: shipMethod.externalId

shipMethod.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
shipMethod.internalId.name: shipMethod.internalId

shipMethod.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items. Sets the ship method for this transaction. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
shipMethod.name.name: shipMethod.name

shippingCost.description: Sets the shipping cost for this transaction. If your account is set up to automatically charge for shipping, this defaults to the value that corresponds to the shipping method selected. Shipping items can be added at Lists > Accounting > Shipping Items.Note that in Web services, whenever an update occurs to quantity or another field that impacts shipping cost, this field's value is automatically recalculated. To prevent this recalculation, submit the shipping cost with your update.
shippingCost.name: shippingCost

shippingTax1Rate.description: This field shows the tax rate for the shipping tax code selected.
shippingTax1Rate.name: shippingTax1Rate

shippingTaxCode.externalId.description: Select the tax code that should apply to shipping for this order.The tax rate for this code shows below.
shippingTaxCode.externalId.name: shippingTaxCode.externalId

shippingTaxCode.internalId.description: Select the tax code that should apply to shipping for this order.The tax rate for this code shows below.
shippingTaxCode.internalId.name: shippingTaxCode.internalId

shippingTaxCode.name.description: Select the tax code that should apply to shipping for this order.The tax rate for this code shows below.
shippingTaxCode.name.name: shippingTaxCode.name

startDate.description: Sets the date for creating the first invoice. This should only be set if Advanced Billing is being used.
startDate.name: startDate

subTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total before any discounts, shipping cost, handling cost or tax is added to the order.
subTotal.name: subTotal

subsidiary.externalId.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - External id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name

syncPartnerTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.
syncPartnerTeams.name: syncPartnerTeams

syncSalesTeams.description: Check this box if you want to update the sales team on the customer's record with changes you make here.
syncSalesTeams.name: syncSalesTeams

taxDetailsOverride.description: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.
taxDetailsOverride.name: taxDetailsOverride

taxItem.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined sales tax item list at Lists > Accounting > Sales Tax Items. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
taxItem.externalId.name: taxItem.externalId

taxItem.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined sales tax item list at Lists > Accounting > Sales Tax Items. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
taxItem.internalId.name: taxItem.internalId

taxItem.name.description: References a value in a user-defined sales tax item list at Lists > Accounting > Sales Tax Items. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
taxItem.name.name: taxItem.name

taxRate.description: This field defaults to the tax rate associated with the taxItem entered but can be modified.
taxRate.name: taxRate

taxRegOverride.description: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.
taxRegOverride.name: taxRegOverride

taxTotal.description: This is a read-only field that returns the result of the  the tax rate multiplied by the taxable total of line items for the transaction.
taxTotal.name: taxTotal

terms.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Term. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
terms.externalId.name: terms.externalId

terms.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Term. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
terms.internalId.name: terms.internalId

terms.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Accounting > Setup Tasks > Accounting Lists > New > Term. In order to retrieve a list of available values for this field, use the GetSelectValue operation.
terms.name.name: terms.name

toBeEmailed.description: Causes the sales order to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.
toBeEmailed.name: toBeEmailed

toBeFaxed.description: Causes the sales order to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.
toBeFaxed.name: toBeFaxed

toBePrinted.description: If enabled, this order is saved in a queue of sales orders and picking tickets that can be printed at a later date.
toBePrinted.name: toBePrinted

total.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.
total.name: total

totalCostEstimate.description: Estimated Cost: Estimated cost of the specific number of items; estimated rate x quantity = estimated cost.
totalCostEstimate.name: totalCostEstimate

trackingNumbers.description: This field is read-only. The numbers are links (for convenience) in the UI, and link to the ItemFulfillment associated with the invoice, sales order, etc. If you want to set item tracking information, do so on the Item Fulfillment record.
trackingNumbers.name: trackingNumbers

tranId.description: Defaults to the largest sales order number incremented by one. You can overwrite with another number.
tranId.name: tranId

tranIsVsoeBundle.description: Check this box to include all items on this transaction as a VSOE bundle.Note: If Rev Rec Dates Specified on Sales Order is the Revenue Recognition Template term source used to allocate revenue, then NetSuite uses the Start and End Dates from the sales order to calculate the Revenue Recognition Schedule.
tranIsVsoeBundle.name: tranIsVsoeBundle

type.value.description: References the credit card records associated with the customer record.
type.value.name: type.value

validFrom.description: Enter the date when this card first became valid. Use the format MM/YYYY.
validFrom.name: validFrom

vsoeAutoCalc.description: Check this box to automatically calculate allocation amounts when you save the transaction.  Allocation determines the revenue amount for individual transaction lines.
vsoeAutoCalc.name: vsoeAutoCalc
